sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: President Joko Widodo announces two first positive cases in Indonesia

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: Travel restrictions expanded to include several cities in South Korea, Italy and Iran. Visitors from these countries must provide a valid health certificate.

sources.name: Kementerian Kesehatan
sources.content: The government has designated 132 treatment facilities across Indonesia.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: The government forms a special task force for COVID-19 (Gugus Tugas Percepatan Penanganan COVID-19) to combat the pandemic in a national scale. This task force will report directly to the president.

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: Following to President Joko Widodo call on social distancing, major Jakarta companies started conducting work from home policy

sources.name: BBC
sources.content: Several regions closed schools and imposed learning activity from home

sources.name: Fatwa MUI no. 14 2020
sources.content: MUI issued a fatwa to forbid non-compulsory worships in mosque during pandemic

sources.name: Kompas.com
sources.content: COVID-19 health protocols have been released to public

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: The government issues a Kepres No. 9 2020 which revise the previous Kepres No. 7 2020. This revision is mainly about changes in special task force's organization structure and budgeting for the task force

sources.name: Kompas.com
sources.content: Kemayoran Athletes Village has officially converted to house COVID-19 patients with mild symptoms. This site claimed to be able to house up to 1800 patients.

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: President Joko Widodo still refuses to impose lockdown on Jakarta.  Bus routes connecting Jakarta and other cities and provinces will remain open following the cancellation of a plan to temporarily suspend operations of AKAP buses.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health issues a regulation to exclude licensing of national import trade system for several health equipments for COVID-19.

sources.name: indonesia.travel
sources.content: The Directorate General of Immigration in Indonesia temporarily ban entry to the Republic of Indonesia for foreign citizens with several exceptions.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of PANRB publishes a circular for all government officials to not traveling and 'mudik', and to always promote social distancing, wearing a mask, not travelling for mudik and healthy lifestyle.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of BUMN publishes a circular for all BUMN employees and their families to not traveling and 'mudik', and to always promote social distancing, wearing a mask, not travelling for mudik and healthy lifestyle.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health releases a technical guideline regarding how to claim a medical cost replacement for hospitals that provide COVID-19 treatment services.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health assigns a large-scale social restriction (PSBB) in DKI Jakarta region.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health issues a guideline for a large-scale social restriction (PSBB) which include schools and offices, religious activities, public activities, social and cultural activities, and transportations. This guideline also explains about the procedure which should be taken if any regional government wants to impose PSBB in their region.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: To reduce people movements during pandemic, Ministry of Religious Affairs, Ministry of Workforces and Ministry of PANRB together releases a regulation to move mass leaves for Idul Fitri holiday to 28, 29, 30 and 31 December.

sources.name: corona.jakarta.go.id
sources.content: Governor of DKI Jakarta publishes a complete technical guidelines to implement a large-scale social restriction (PSBB)in the region.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Transportation publishes a health procedure to prevent the spreadness of COVID-19 for all kinds of public transportations.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of PANRB releases a new circular No. 46 2020 which revise the previous circular No. 36 2020. The changes include a traveling ban for families of goverment officials and unimportant leaves prohibition.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Industry releases a procedure for requesting permission for carrying industrial operations out during pandemic.

sources.name: Kompas.com
sources.content: A large-scale social restriction (PSBB) is effectively started in DKI Jakarta, followed by several other regions like Bogor, Depok, Bekasi and Tangerang.

sources.name: jdih.setkab.go.id
sources.content: President Joko Widodo declares COVID-19 as a national health emergency.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health assigns a large-scale social restriction (PSBB) in Kabupaten Tangerang, Kota Tangerang and Kota Tangerang Selatan.

sources.name: setkab.go.id
sources.content: President Joko Widodo declares COVID-19 as a national disaster after it has infected 4557 people and caused 399 deaths in Indonesia.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health releases a circular to promote wearing a mask in public and washing hands frequently as suggested by WHO.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Governor of Jawa Barat imposes a large-scale social restriction (PSBB) in Kota Bandung, Kota Cimahi, Kabupaten Bandung, Kabupaten Bandung Barat and Kabupaten Sumedang.

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: President Joko Widodo announces to ban Idul Fitri mudik (exodus) starting from 24 April to limit the spread of COVID-19

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: Several long distance transportations such as airplanes, trains and buses are banned until at least 31 May

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health publishes a circular to stress again about the medical cost reimbursement procedures for hospitals that provide COVID-19 treatment services. There are some additional information regarding charging procedure for patient with hereditary disease and patient with complications

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Government of DKI Jakarta will enforce a penalty for any violation during large-scale social restrictions. Individual can be fined from Rp100.000 up to Rp250.000, and companies can be fined from Rp5.000.000 up to Rp50.000.000 depending on certain classification.

sources.name: jdih.setneg.go.id
sources.content: President issues a regulation to postpone 2020 regional elections until December with a potential to prolong the postponement should the national disaster persist.

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: Transportation Minister says that it is possible for the government to allow all means of public transportation to start operations on 7 May to accommodate particular individuals while insisting on banning this year’s Idul Fitri mudik.

sources.name: covid.19.go.id
sources.content: Special Task Force for COVID-19 releases a circular to describe a traveling ban exception for individuals with certain criterions. The exception include government officers or private companies who provide essential logistic services, emergency patient, returning migrant workers or students from abroad.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Directorate General of Sea Transportation publishes a circular to operate all means of sea transportations for supporting essential logistic services and traveling for particular individuals as described by Special Task Force for COVID-19 via circular No. 4 2020.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Following to Special Task Force's circular No. 4 2020, Directorate General of Land Transportation publishes a technical guideline to operate land transportations for supporting essential logistic services and traveling for particular individuals

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Following to Special Task Force's circular No. 4 2020, Directorate General of Railroad System publishes a technical guideline to operate special train for supporting traveling for particular individuals

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Following to Special Task Force's circular No. 4 2020, Ministry of PANRB releases a circular to allow government officials with certain criterion to travel by following the procedure explained in the letter

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: The government begins to tighten its monitoring of the mudik ban as the Idul Fitri holiday on 24-25 May is approaching. Violators will either be stopped or turned back.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Using SE 15/2020, the Minister of Religious Affairs allows houses of worship to reopen if it is deemed safe by its respective regional head of COVID-19 Task Force and as long as they implement a strict health and hygiene protocol.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan has issued Pergub No. 51/2020 on the implementation of relaxing PSBB (transitional PSBB). The document lists various regulations in place during transitional PSBB period, such as allowing business to operate with 50% presence.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: The Ministry of Transportation has issued regulation Permenhub No. 41/2020 to relax the various restrictions placed by the previous regulation (Permenhub No. 18/2020). The relaxations include allowing motorcycle taxi services (ojek) to continue operating again and increase the maximum capacity of flight passengers to 70%.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: National Covid-19 Task Force publishes a circular No. 8 2020 to regulate working shifts for companies within Jabodetabek region in effort to reducing the potential of crowd arising in public transportations during peak hours.

sources.name: covid19.go.id
sources.content: Ministry of Health releases a new health protocol to support people's activity in public without creating new cluster during pandemic period.

sources.name: The Jakarta Post
sources.content: President Joko Widodo at the cabinet meeting on Sunday, 28 June 2020 highlighted the slow disbursement of the government COVID-19 response budget as he called on ministers to go extra mile. One of the biggest highlight is the spending of the COVID-19 budgets for health ministry which is only about 1.53% from the total of 75 trillion rupiahs.
